column1: West Puente Valley is an unincorporated community and census-designated place in Los Angeles County
column4: northwest of La Puente.  The population was 22
column7: 589 at the 2000 census. The community is probably named for its location related to the city of La Puente.

column1: West Puente Valley is an unincorporated community located in the heart of the San Gabriel Valley
column2: between Downtown Los Angeles and Pomona. The community is easily accessible to the San Gabriel River Freeway to the west
column3: the San Bernardino Freeway to the north
column4: and the Pomona Freeway to the south.

column1: West Puente Valley is bounded by La Puente to the south and east
column4: and the San Gabriel River Freeway and the western boundary of City of Industry to the west. The community is mainly residential. The ZIP code that serves the community is 91744 and 91746.

column1: West Puente Valley is located at 34°3′3″N 117°58′11″W (34.050838
column2: -117.969783).According to the United States Census Bureau
column3: the community has a total area of 1.8 square miles (4.5 km²)

column1: In the state legislature West Puente Valley is located in the 24th Senate District
column4: represented by Democrat Edward P. Hernandez. Federally
column5: West Puente Valley is located in California's 32nd congressional district
